text: General elections were held in Argentina on 27 October 2019, to elect the president of Argentina, members of the national congress and the governors of most provinces. Former Cabinet Chief Alberto Fern√°ndez of the Justicialist Party won the presidency, and incumbent president Mauricio Macri lost his re- election bid for a second term. Macri became the first incumbent president in Argentine history to be defeated in his reelection bid. ==References== Category:2019 elections Category:2010s in Argentina Category:Elections in South America Category:General elections
title: 2019 Argentine general election
